meanings.definition: A strap or straps placed around a horse's head to hold a bit in its mouth.
meanings.sent1: The shiny headstalls gleamed in the sunlight at the horse show.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the headstalls on the horse before going for a ride.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pony tried to chew on the headstalls during the race.
meanings.sent4: The headstalls of responsibility weighed heavily on the young jockey.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the headstalls caught the attention of the spectators.

meanings.definition: A headstall is a part of a bridle that fits over a horse's head and holds the bit in place.
meanings.sent1: The leather headstalls were soft and comfortable for the horse.
meanings.sent2: The rider carefully adjusted the headstalls before mounting the horse.
meanings.sent3: The headstalls seemed to whisper secrets to the curious foal.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the sturdy headstalls that kept her focused on the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The headstalls creaked softly as the horse shook its head.
